help.title: Help
help.version: Route optimizer for food retail distribution

overview.intro: Chaos RouteManager is a planning and optimization tool for delivery routes in food retail distribution. It manages the entire logistics chain: dispatch bases, points of sale, vehicles, volumes to deliver, and construction of optimized tours.
overview.purpose: The dashboard provides a summary view of daily activity: number of tours, active PDVs, available vehicles, and total kilometers. Trend charts and status distribution graphs allow you to track performance.

login.intro: Access to the application is protected by authentication. Each user has a username and password created by an administrator.
login.step1: Enter your username in the first field
login.step3: Click ¬´ Sign in ¬ª ‚Äî you will be redirected to your home page
login.tip: Your session remains active for 30 minutes. If the session expires, you will be automatically redirected to the login page.

navigation.intro: The application consists of a navigation sidebar (on the left), a header (at the top), and a main content area.
navigation.sidebarLabel: Sidebar ‚Äî click on a menu to navigate
navigation.permissions: Visible menus depend on your permissions ‚Äî only menus you have access to are displayed
navigation.theme: Use the ‚òÄÔ∏è/üåô button in the header to toggle between dark and light theme
navigation.language: Change language using the FR / EN / PT / NL buttons in the header

scope.intro: The scope selector in the header allows you to filter data by country and/or region. The map automatically recenters on the selected area.
scope.selectCountry: Click on the üìç indicator to open the scope selector
scope.selectRegion: Select a country to filter regions, then a region to narrow down
scope.mapZoom: The map automatically zooms to PDVs and bases in the selected area
scope.reset: Choose ¬´ Global ¬ª to reset the filter and see all data

datatable.intro: Most pages use a data table with the same features: search, sort, customizable columns, import/export, and CRUD actions.
datatable.search: Instant search: type in the search field to filter rows in real time
datatable.sort: Sort by column: click on a column header to sort (ascending/descending)
datatable.columns: Customizable columns: click ¬´ Columns ¬ª to hide/show columns
datatable.create: Create: click the ¬´ New ¬ª button to open the creation form
datatable.edit: Edit: click the ‚úèÔ∏è icon on a row to edit the record
datatable.delete: Delete: click the üóëÔ∏è icon then confirm the deletion
datatable.import: Excel import: click ¬´ Import ¬ª and drop an .xlsx file
datatable.export: Excel export: click ¬´ Export ¬ª to download data in Excel format
datatable.deleteWarning: Deletion is irreversible. Make sure not to delete a record used by other data (e.g., a PDV referenced by volumes).

countries.intro: This page manages countries and their regions. Regions are the basic geographic division used for user scope and data filtering.
countries.tabs: Two tabs: ¬´ Countries ¬ª to manage countries (name + ISO code), ¬´ Regions ¬ª for regions
countries.filterByCountry: Click on a country to filter its regions
countries.regionLink: Each region is linked to a country ‚Äî it serves as the basis for the geographic scope of users

bases.intro: Logistics bases are dispatch warehouses. Each base has GPS coordinates (displayed on the map), an address, and preparation speeds by temperature.
bases.fields: Main fields: name, code, address, GPS coordinates, parent region
bases.activities: Each base can be associated with activities (dedicated tab in Base Activities)
bases.speeds: Preparation speeds are defined by temperature (DRY, FRESH, FROZEN, MIXED) and cadence (fast, slow) in EQP/hour
bases.map: Bases are displayed on the map with a dedicated icon

pdvs.intro: Points Of Sale (PDV) represent stores to be delivered. Each PDV has specific delivery constraints.
pdvs.types: PDV types: Supermarket Food, General Supermarket, Hypermarket, Netto, Drive, Urban Convenience
pdvs.delivery: Delivery slots: start and end time of delivery, unload time per EQP
pdvs.constraints: Access constraints: SAS (buffer zone), unloading dock, vehicle size restrictions
pdvs.map: PDVs are displayed on the map with color coding by status (see legend)

vehicles.intro: Fleet management. Each vehicle has a temperature type, size, and capacity.
vehicles.tempTypes: Temperature types: FROZEN, FRESH, DRY, BI-TEMP (2 zones), TRI-TEMP (3 zones)
vehicles.types: Vehicle types: Semi-trailer, Tractor, Tractor + Trailer, City, LV
vehicles.capacity: Capacity defined in EQP (pallet equivalent) and in kg
vehicles.tailgate: Tailgate: retractable or foldable (impacts PDV delivery constraints)

volumes.intro: Volumes represent goods to be delivered to each PDV for a given date. They are the ¬´ building blocks ¬ª that make up tours.
volumes.fields: Fields: destination PDV, number of EQP, weight (kg), temperature class, origin base, preparation slot
volumes.link: Each volume is linked to a PDV and a dispatch base ‚Äî it represents an order or a flow
volumes.import: Bulk import via Excel to load volumes for the day

contracts.intro: Transport contracts link a transporter to a vehicle with tariff conditions and an availability schedule.
contracts.costs: Costs: fixed daily rate (‚Ç¨), cost/km (‚Ç¨), cost/hour (‚Ç¨), minimum hours and km per day
contracts.schedule: Weekly schedule: availability days from Monday to Sunday
contracts.unavailable: Exceptional unavailability dates (holidays, maintenance) to be entered in the calendar

tourPlanning.intro: Tour planning is the heart of the application. The screen is divided into 3 areas: available volumes (left), map (center), and current tour (right).
tourPlanning.step1: Select a dispatch base and vehicle type
tourPlanning.step2: Set the departure time from the base
tourPlanning.step3: Add volumes by clicking them in the list or on the PDV on the map
tourPlanning.step4: Reorder stops by dragging and dropping (drag & drop)
tourPlanning.step5: Check fill rate and estimated times
tourPlanning.step6: Validate the tour or save it as a draft
tourPlanning.tip: If a volume exceeds the remaining capacity, a dialog offers to split it: choose the number of EQP to load, the rest will remain available.
tourPlanning.tipScheduling: ¬´ Scheduling ¬ª tab: drag validated tours onto the timeline to organize the day. Vehicle overlaps are flagged automatically.

tourHistory.intro: The history displays all created tours with their details, KPIs, and costs. You can filter by date, base, vehicle.
tourHistory.statuses: Statuses: Draft ‚Üí Validated ‚Üí In progress ‚Üí Completed
tourHistory.kpi: Overall KPIs: total tours, total EQP, total km, total cost, estimated CO‚ÇÇ
tourHistory.delete: Deleting a tour returns its volumes to be available for new assignments

admin.intro: The Administration section is reserved for users with ¬´ users ¬ª and/or ¬´ roles ¬ª permissions. It allows you to manage user accounts and access roles.
admin.usersCreate: Create a user: username, email, password, role(s), region(s) scope
admin.usersRoles: A user can have multiple roles ‚Äî permissions are cumulative
admin.usersRegions: Assigned regions limit visible data (PDVs, volumes, bases‚Ä¶). No region = global access
admin.usersSuperadmin: The superadmin has access to everything without restriction ‚Äî do not assign this status unless necessary
admin.rolesIntro: A role groups a set of permissions. The matrix allows you to finely select rights by resource and action.
admin.rolesMatrix: Each cell in the matrix corresponds to a permission: resource (row) √ó action (column)
admin.rolesToggle: Use ¬´ Toggle all ¬ª to check/uncheck an entire row or column
admin.warning: Warning: deleting a permission from a role immediately affects all users with that role.
